title: Mike Ashley's Sports Direct snaps up retail park
text:
Sports Direct tycoon Mike Ashley has added another business to his retail empire, this time a shopping park.

The acquisitive billionaire completed a £25.4m deal to buy Brookfield Shopping Park in Cheshunt, Hertfordshire.

The 93,000sq ft site was sold to Mr Ashley for a third of the price that JP Morgan Asset Management paid in 2015.

“We are already working hard on plans to breathe new life into Brookfield Shopping Park,” said Michael Murray, Sports Direct’s head of elevation and Mr Ashley’s future son-in-law.

“We believe in bricks & mortar retail and plan to transform this retail park into a modern, aspirational shopping destination for the local area.”
